p:
In the present context, the basic reproduction number R 0 is used as a tool in evaluating and predicting risk zones for malaria transmission. High values of R 0 (> 1) correspond to malaria risk zones. Our results indicate that for a population density of M
H = 100 and an immunity coefficient of ξ = 0.1, the values of R 0 range between 0 and 9. Such values provide an overall view of the intensity of malaria transmission in the region. The areas in Africa where R 0 was close to the value 9 correspond to locations with high malaria prevalence. The value of R 0 tends to zero in areas with low risk of malaria transmission. The maximum values of R 0 are obtained at the locations where the optimal temperature for malaria transmission is about 25 °C.
